dimensional data
dependent_to.name: spiner

dependent_to.description:
SPIRAL is a program generation system for linear transforms and other
mathematical functions that produces very high performance code for a
wide spectrum of hardware platforms.
dependent_to.name: spiral-software

dependent_to.description:
Specialized Parallel Linear Algebra, providing distributed GEMM
functionality for specific matrix distributions with optional GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: spla

dependent_to.description:
Spot is a C++11 library for omega-automata manipulation and model
checking.
dependent_to.name: spot

dependent_to.description:
SPRNG: A Scalable Library For Pseudorandom Number Generation Sprng is a
distributed process-aware random number generator that avoids
correlations in random number sequences across processes.
dependent_to.name: sprng

dependent_to.description:
SQLCipher is an SQLite extension that provides 256 bit AES encryption of
database files.
dependent_to.name: sqlcipher

dependent_to.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.
dependent_to.name: sqlite

dependent_to.description:
DB Browser for SQLite (DB4S) is a high quality, visual, open source tool
to create, design, and edit database files compatible with SQLite.
dependent_to.name: sqlitebrowser

dependent_to.description: Squashfs - read only compressed filesystem
dependent_to.name: squashfs

dependent_to.description:
Allows non-root users to mount squashfs files without the overhead of
squashfuse.
dependent_to.name: squashfs-mount

dependent_to.description: squashfuse - Mount SquashFS archives using FUSE
dependent_to.name: squashfuse

dependent_to.description: C function library for sequence analysis.
dependent_to.name: squid

dependent_to.description:
The SRA Toolkit and SDK from NCBI is a collection of tools and libraries
for using data in the INSDC Sequence Read Archives.
dependent_to.name: sra-tools

dependent_to.description:
srcML is an XML format for source code. The XML markup identifies
elements of the abstract syntax of the source-code language. The toolkit
includes parsing supports conversion of C, C++, C#, and Java both to and
from the srcML format. The format allows leveraging XML tools to support
the various tasks of source code exploration, analysis, and
manipulation.
dependent_to.name: srcml

dependent_to.description:
SCANL's srcml_identifier_getter_tool. reads a srcML archive and outputs
all identifiers in that archive through standard out.
dependent_to.name: srcml-identifier-getter-tool

dependent_to.description:
SRILM (SRI Language Modeling Toolkit) is a toolkit for building and
applying statistical language models (LMs), primarily for use in speech
recognition, statistical tagging and segmentation, and machine
translation.
dependent_to.name: srilm

dependent_to.description: Client side implementation of the SRMv2 specification.
dependent_to.name: srm-ifce

dependent_to.description:
Sshpass is a tool for non-interactivly performing password
authentication with SSH's so called "interactive keyboard password
authentication". Most user should use SSH's more secure public key
authentiaction instead.
dependent_to.name: sshpass

dependent_to.description:
ssht: Spin spherical harmonic transforms. The SSHT code provides
functionality to perform fast and exact spin spherical harmonic
transforms based on the sampling theorem on the sphere derived in our
paper: A novel sampling theorem on the sphere
<http://dx.doi.org/10.1109/TSP.2011.2166394>.
dependent_to.name: ssht

dependent_to.description:
A program that replaces sendmail on workstations that should send their
mail via the departmental mailhub from which they pick up their mail.
dependent_to.name: ssmtp

dependent_to.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST) core provides a parallel
discrete event simulation (PDES) framework for performing architecture
simulations of existing and proposed HPC systems
dependent_to.name: sst-core

dependent_to.description:
The DUMPI package provides libraries to collect and read traces of MPI
applications. Traces are created by linking an application with a
library that uses the PMPI interface to intercept MPI calls. DUMPI
records signatures of all MPI-1 and MPI-2 subroutine calls, return
values, request information, and PAPI counters.
dependent_to.name: sst-dumpi

dependent_to.description:
SST Elements implements a range of components for performing
architecture simulation from node-level to system-level using the SST
discrete event core.
dependent_to.name: sst-elements

dependent_to.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit Macroscale Element Library simulates
large-scale parallel computer architectures for the coarse-grained study
of distributed-memory applications. The simulator is driven from either
a trace file or skeleton application. SST/macro's modular architecture
can be extended with additional network models, trace file formats,
software services, and processor models.
dependent_to.name: sst-macro

dependent_to.description: Provides transports like uGNI and verbs that run in the simulator
dependent_to.name: sst-transports

dependent_to.description:
Stacks is a software pipeline for building loci from short-read
sequences, such as those generated on the Illumina platform.
dependent_to.name: stacks

dependent_to.description:
Io_lib is a library for reading/writing various bioinformatics file
formats.
dependent_to.name: staden-io-lib

dependent_to.description: STAR is an ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner.
dependent_to.name: star

dependent_to.description:
STARlight is a Monte Carlo that simulates two-photon and photon-Pomeron
interactions between relativistic nuclei and protons.
dependent_to.name: starlight

dependent_to.description:
StarPU runtime system StarPU is a runtime support for scheduling
applications written as task graphs on heterogeneous multi-core
architectures. Tasks may define several implementations, for different
architectures (e.g one implementation for CPUs, and one implementation
for CUDA). StarPU takes care of scheduling and executing those tasks as
efficiently as possible over the entire machine. It also provides a
high-level data management library which enforces memory coherency over
the differents processing units of the machine, and over a cluster when
using distributed computing. Various data structures are supported
mainline (vectors, dense matrices, CSR/BCSR/COO sparse matrices, ...),
but application-specific data structures can also be supported.
dependent_to.name: starpu

dependent_to.description:
startup-notification contains a reference implementation of the
freedesktop startup notification protocol.
dependent_to.name: startup-notification

dependent_to.description: Library to create, manipulate, and export graphs Graphlib.
dependent_to.name: stat

dependent_to.description: STC: The Swift-Turbine Compiler
dependent_to.name: stc

dependent_to.description: The proposed C++ framework for asynchronous and parallel programming.
dependent_to.name: stdexec

dependent_to.description: STochastic Engine for Pathway Simulation
dependent_to.name: steps

dependent_to.description:
The STINGER in-memory graph store and dynamic graph analysis platform.
Millions to billions of vertices and edges at thousands to millions of
updates per second.
dependent_to.name: stinger

dependent_to.description:
GNU Stow: a symlink farm manager GNU Stow is a symlink farm manager
which takes distinct packages of software and/or data located in
separate directories on the filesystem, and makes them appear to be
installed in the same place.
dependent_to.name: stow

dependent_to.description:
Strace is a diagnostic, debugging and instructional userspace utility
for Linux. It is used to monitor and tamper with interactions between
processes and the Linux kernel, which include system calls, signal
deliveries, and changes of process state.
dependent_to.name: strace

dependent_to.description:
The STREAM benchmark is a simple synthetic benchmark program that
measures sustainable memory bandwidth (in MB/s) and the corresponding
computation rate for simple vector kernels.
dependent_to.name: stream

dependent_to.description:
stress is a deliberately simple workload generator for POSIX systems. It
imposes a configurable amount of CPU, memory, I/O, and disk stress on
the system. It is written in C, and is free software licensed under the
GPLv2.
dependent_to.name: stress

dependent_to.description:
stress-ng will stress test a computer system in various selectable ways.
It was designed to exercise various physical subsystems of a computer as
well as the various operating system kernel interfaces.
dependent_to.name: stress-ng

dependent_to.description:
Stressful Application Test (or stressapptest, its unix name) is a
memory interface test. It tries to maximize randomized traffic to memory
from processor and I/O, with the intent of creating a realistic high
load situation in order to test the existing hardware devices in a
computer. It has been used at Google for some time and now it is
available under the apache 2.0 license.
dependent_to.name: stressapptest

dependent_to.description:
A single-file header-only version of a C++17-like string_view for
C++98, C++11 and later
dependent_to.name: string-view-lite

dependent_to.description:
StringTie is a fast and highly efficient assembler of RNA-Seq alignments
into potential transcripts.
dependent_to.name: stringtie

dependent_to.description:
STRIPACK: Delaunay Triangulation rewritten in Fortran 90 by John
Burkardt at
https://people.sc.fsu.edu/~jburkardt/f_src/stripack/stripack.html The
original Fortran 77 package STRIPACK is available from netlib as
algorithm number 772 at https://www.netlib.org/toms/772.gz Dr. Renka's
articles were published in the ACM Transactions on Mathematical
Software, Vol. 23, No 3, September 1997
https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/275323.275329
dependent_to.name: stripack

dependent_to.description:
Structure is a free software package for using multi-locus genotype data
to investigate population structure.
dependent_to.name: structure

dependent_to.description:
STRUMPACK -- STRUctured Matrix PACKage - provides linear solvers for
sparse matrices and for dense rank-structured matrices, i.e., matrices
that exhibit some kind of low-rank property. It provides a distributed
memory fully algebraic sparse solver and preconditioner. The
preconditioner is mostly aimed at large sparse linear systems which
result from the discretization of a partial differential equation, but
is not limited to any particular type of problem. STRUMPACK also
provides preconditioned GMRES and BiCGStab iterative solvers.
dependent_to.name: strumpack

dependent_to.description:
The Subread software package is a tool kit for processing next-gen
sequencing data.
dependent_to.name: subread

dependent_to.description: Apache Subversion - an open source version control system.
dependent_to.name: subversion

dependent_to.description: SuiteSparse is a suite of sparse matrix algorithms
dependent_to.name: suite-sparse

dependent_to.description:
Sumaclust aims to cluster sequences in a way that is fast and exact at
the same time.
dependent_to.name: sumaclust

dependent_to.description:
Eclipse SUMO is an open source, highly portable, microscopic and
continuous road traffic simulation package designed to handle large road
networks. It allows for intermodal simulation including pedestrians and
comes with a large set of tools for scenario creation.
dependent_to.name: sumo

dependent_to.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)
dependent_to.name: sundials

dependent_to.description:
The Stanford unstructured-grid, nonhydrostatic, parallel coastal ocean
model.
dependent_to.name: suntans

dependent_to.description:
SuperChic is a Fortran based Monte Carlo event generator for exclusive
and photon-initiated production in proton and heavy ion collisions. A
range of Standard Model final states are implemented, in most cases with
spin correlations where relevant, and a fully differential treatment of
the soft survival factor is given. Arbitrary user-defined histograms and
cuts may be made, as well as unweighted events in the HEPEVT, HEPMC and
LHE formats.
dependent_to.name: superchic

dependent_to.description:
SuperLU is a general purpose library for the direct solution of large,
sparse, nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance
machines. SuperLU is designed for sequential machines.
dependent_to.name: superlu

dependent_to.description:
A general purpose library for the direct solution of large, sparse,
nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance machines.
dependent_to.name: superlu-dist

dependent_to.description:
SuperLU is a general purpose library for the direct solution of large,
sparse, nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance
machines. SuperLU_MT is designed for shared memory parallel machines.
dependent_to.name: superlu-mt

dependent_to.description: Supermagic is a very simple MPI sanity code. Nothing more, nothing less.
dependent_to.name: supermagic

dependent_to.description:
Survey is a high level performance tool product from Trenza, Inc. The
survey collector/analytics framework is a new generation, high level,
lightweight multiplatform Linux tool set that targets metric collection
for high level performance analysis of applications running on both
single node and on large scale platforms, including the Cray platforms.
The collector is designed to work on sequential, MPI, OpenMP, and hybrid
codes and directly leverages several interfaces available for tools
inside current MPI implementations including: MPICH, MVAPICH, MPT, and
OpenMPI. It also supports multiple architectures and has been tested on
machines based on Intel, AMD, ARM, and IBM P8/9 processors and
integrated AMD and NVIDIA GPUs. Survey is a licensed product with the
source not openly available. To access the survey source and build with
spack please contact: Trenza Inc. via: dmont@trenzasynergy.com or
jeg@trenzasynergy.com
dependent_to.name: survey

dependent_to.description: SW4 implements substantial capabilities for 3-D seismic modeling.
dependent_to.name: sw4

dependent_to.description:
Sw4lite is a bare bone version of SW4 intended for testing performance
optimizations in a few important numerical kernels of SW4.
dependent_to.name: sw4lite

dependent_to.description:
SWAN is a third-generation wave model, developed at Delft University of
Technology, that computes random, short-crested wind-generated waves in
coastal regions and inland waters. For more information about SWAN, see
a short overview of model features. This list reflects on the scientific
relevance of the development of SWAN.
dependent_to.name: swan

dependent_to.description: A scalable and fully parallelized genome assembler.
dependent_to.name: swap-assembler

dependent_to.description: A robust and fast clustering method for amplicon-based studies.
dependent_to.name: swarm

dependent_to.description:
A stand-alone version of HACC's distributed-memory, pencil-decomposed,
parallel 3D FFT.
dependent_to.name: swfft

dependent_to.description:
SWFTools is a collection of utilities for working with Adobe Flash files
(SWF files). The tool collection includes programs for reading SWF
files, combining them, and creating them from other content (like
images, sound files, videos or sourcecode). SWFTools is released under
the GPL.
dependent_to.name: swftools

dependent_to.description:
SPH With Inter-dependent Fine-grained Tasking (SWIFT) provides
astrophysicists with a state of the art framework to perform particle
based simulations.
dependent_to.name: swiftsim

dependent_to.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
dependent_to.name: swig

dependent_to.description:
SWI-Prolog is a versatile implementation of the Prolog language.
Although SWI-Prolog gained its popularity primarily in education, its
development is mostly driven by the needs for application development.
This is facilitated by a rich interface to other IT components by
supporting many document types and (network) protocols as well as a
comprehensive low-level interface to C that is the basis for high-level
interfaces to C++, Java (bundled), C#, Python, etc (externally
available). Data type extensions such as dicts and strings as well as
full support for Unicode and unbounded integers simplify smooth exchange
of data with other components.
dependent_to.name: swipl

dependent_to.description: SymEngine is a fast symbolic manipulation library, written in C++.
dependent_to.name: symengine

dependent_to.description: Scan or change symbolic links.
dependent_to.name: symlinks

dependent_to.description:
symPACK is a sparse symmetric matrix direct linear solver, with optional
support for CUDA devices
dependent_to.name: sympack

dependent_to.description: SymPol is a C++ tool to work with symmetric polyhedra
dependent_to.name: sympol

dependent_to.description:
A library for capturing hardware topology and attributes of compute
systems.
dependent_to.name: sys-sage

dependent_to.description: Scriptable database and system performance benchmark.
dependent_to.name: sysbench

dependent_to.description: A tool to derive theoretical systematic uncertainties
dependent_to.name: syscalc

dependent_to.description:
This package's purpose is to provide a set of utilities for interfacing
with sysfs, a virtual filesystem in Linux kernel versions 2.5+ that
provides a tree of system devices. While a filesystem is a very useful
interface, we've decided to provide a stable programming interface that
will hopefully make it easier for applications to query system devices
and their attributes.
dependent_to.name: sysfsutils

dependent_to.description:
sysget is a bridge that lets you use one syntax to every package manager
on every unix-based operating system.
dependent_to.name: sysget

dependent_to.description:
The sysstat package contains various utilities, common to many
commercial Unixes, to monitor system performance and usage activity
Sysstat also contains tools you can schedule via cron or systemd to
collect and historize performance and activity data.
dependent_to.name: sysstat

dependent_to.description:
SystemC: System level modeling, design exploration, performance
modeling, and more.
dependent_to.name: systemc

dependent_to.description:
SystemTap provides free software (GPL) infrastructure to simplify the
gathering of information about the running Linux system. This assists
diagnosis of a performance or functional problem. SystemTap eliminates
the need for the developer to go through the tedious and disruptive
instrument, recompile, install, and reboot sequence that may be
otherwise required to collect data.
dependent_to.name: systemtap

dependent_to.description: Error-bounded Lossy Compressor for HPC Data
dependent_to.name: sz

dependent_to.description: Refactorization of SZ in cpp
dependent_to.name: sz-cpp

dependent_to.description: SZ3 is the next generation of the SZ compressor framework
dependent_to.name: sz3

dependent_to.description:
SZauto: SZ C++ Version that Supports Second-Order Prediction and
Parameter Optimization
dependent_to.name: szauto

dependent_to.description: An ultra fast error bounded compressor for scientific datasets
dependent_to.name: szx

dependent_to.description:
t8code is a C/C++ library to manage parallel adaptive meshes with
various element types. t8code uses a collection (a forest) of multiple
connected adaptive space-trees in parallel and scales to at least one
million MPI ranks and over one Trillion mesh elements.
dependent_to.name: t8code

dependent_to.description: Generic indexer for TAB-delimited genome position files
dependent_to.name: tabix

dependent_to.description:
TALASS: Topological Analysis of Large-Scale Simulations This package
compiles the talass tool chain thar implements various topological
algorithms to analyze large scale data. The package is organized
hierarchical FileFormat < Statistics < StreamingTopology and any of the
subsets can be build stand- alone.
dependent_to.name: talass

dependent_to.description:
Talloc provides a hierarchical, reference counted memory pool system
with destructors. It is the core memory allocator used in Samba.
dependent_to.name: talloc

dependent_to.description:
Tandem is a scientific software for SEAS modelling and for solving
Poisson and linear elasticity problems. It implements the Symmetric
Interior Penalty Galerkin (SIPG) method using unstructured simplicial
meshes (triangle meshes in 2D, tetrahedral meshes in 3D).
dependent_to.name: tandem

dependent_to.description:
Tangram is an material interface reconstruction package used in
multimaterial ALE codes and multi-material remapping
(https://github.com/laristra/portage)
dependent_to.name: tangram

dependent_to.description:
tantan is a tool to mask simple regions (low complexity and short-period
tandem repeats) in DNA, RNA, and protein sequences.
dependent_to.name: tantan

dependent_to.description:
GNU Tar provides the ability to create tar archives, as well as various
other kinds of manipulation.
dependent_to.name: tar

dependent_to.description: Feature-rich console based todo list manager
dependent_to.name: task

dependent_to.description: TaskWarrior task synchronization daemon
dependent_to.name: taskd

dependent_to.description: Taskflow helps you quickly write parallel tasks programs in modern C++.
dependent_to.name: taskflow

dependent_to.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.
dependent_to.name: tasmanian

dependent_to.description:
A portable profiling and tracing toolkit for performance analysis of
parallel programs written in Fortran, C, C++, UPC, Java, Python.
dependent_to.name: tau

dependent_to.description: Tauola is a event generator for tau decays.
dependent_to.name: tauola

dependent_to.description:
The STUTTGART TB-LMTO program. The linear muffin-tin orbital (LMTO)
method has been described in numerous publications. Use of this software
is subject to the license at https://www2.fkf.mpg.de/andersen/LMTODOC/no
de180.html#SECTION000130000000000000000
dependent_to.name: tb-lmto

dependent_to.description:
Tcl (Tool Command Language) is a very powerful but easy to learn dynamic
programming language, suitable for a very wide range of uses, including
web and desktop applications, networking, administration, testing and
many more. Open source and business-friendly, Tcl is a mature yet
evolving language that is truly cross platform, easily deployed and
highly extensible.
dependent_to.name: tcl

dependent_to.description:
[incr Tcl] is the most widely used O-O system for Tcl. The name is a
play on C++, and [incr Tcl] provides a similar object model, including
multiple inheritence and public and private classes and variables.
dependent_to.name: tcl-itcl

dependent_to.description:
Tcllib is a collection of utility modules for Tcl. These modules provide
a wide variety of functionality, from implementations of standard data
structures to implementations of common networking protocols. The intent
is to collect commonly used function into a single library, which users
can rely on to be available and stable.
dependent_to.name: tcl-tcllib

dependent_to.description:
TclXML is an API for parsing XML documents using the Tcl scripting
language. It is also a package including a DOM implementation (TclDOM)
and XSL Transformations (TclXSLT). These allow Tcl scripts to read,
manipulate and write XML documents.
dependent_to.name: tcl-tclxml

dependent_to.description: Templatized C++ Command Line Parser
dependent_to.name: tclap

dependent_to.description: T-Coffee is a multiple sequence alignment program.
dependent_to.name: tcoffee

dependent_to.description:
Tcpdump prints out a description of the contents of packets on a network
interface that match the Boolean expression; the description is preceded
by a time stamp, printed, by default, as hours, minutes, seconds, and
fractions of a second since midnight.
dependent_to.name: tcpdump

dependent_to.description:
tcptrace is a tool written by Shawn Ostermann at Ohio University for
analysis of TCP dump files. It can take as input the files produced by
several popular packet-capture programs, including tcpdump, snoop,
etherpeek, HP Net Metrix, and WinDump.
dependent_to.name: tcptrace

dependent_to.description:
Tcsh is an enhanced but completely compatible version of csh, the C
shell. Tcsh is a command language interpreter which can be used both as
an interactive login shell and as a shell script command processor. Tcsh
includes a command line editor, programmable word completion, spelling
correction, a history mechanism, job control and a C language like
syntax.
dependent_to.name: tcsh

dependent_to.description:
An open-source big data platform designed and optimized for the Internet
of Things (IoT).
dependent_to.name: tdengine

dependent_to.description:
Proxy Application. TeaLeaf is a mini-app that solves the linear heat
conduction equation on a spatially decomposed regularly grid using a 5
point stencil with implicit solvers.
dependent_to.name: tealeaf

dependent_to.description:
The TecIO library allows third-party applications to read and write
Tecplot file format.
dependent_to.name: tecio

dependent_to.description:
TECkit is a low-level toolkit intended to be used by applications for
conversions between text encodings. For example, it can be used when
importing legacy text into a Unicode-based application. The primary
component of TECkit is a library: the TECkit engine. The engine relies
on mapping tables in a specific, documented binary format. The TECkit
compiler creates these tables from plain-text, human-readable
descriptions.
dependent_to.name: teckit

dependent_to.description:
Telegraf is an agent for collecting, processing, aggregating, and
writing metrics.
dependent_to.name: telegraf

dependent_to.description:
TempestRemap is a conservative, consistent and monotone remapping
package for arbitrary grid geometry with support for finite volumes and
finite elements. There is still quite a bit of work to be done, but any
feedback is appreciated on the software in its current form
dependent_to.name: tempestremap

dependent_to.description:
Templight is a Clang-based tool to profile the time and memory
consumption of template instantiations and to perform interactive
debugging sessions to gain introspection into the template instantiation
process.
dependent_to.name: templight

dependent_to.description: Supporting tools for the Templight Profiler
dependent_to.name: templight-tools

dependent_to.description: Tempo is a program for pulsar timing data analysis.
dependent_to.name: tempo

dependent_to.description: A distribution of Nginx with some advanced features.
dependent_to.name: tengine

dependent_to.description:
A prebuilt tensorflow serving client from the tensorflow serving proto
files
dependent_to.name: tensorflow-serving-client

dependent_to.description:
A tensor-aware point-to-point communication primitive for machine
learning.
dependent_to.name: tensorpipe

dependent_to.description:
This is the GNU termcap library, a library of C functions that enable
programs to send control strings to terminals in a way independent of
the terminal type.
dependent_to.name: termcap

dependent_to.description: Tesseract Open Source OCR Engine.
dependent_to.name: tesseract

dependent_to.description: Sandia OpenSHMEM unit tests and performance testing suite.
dependent_to.name: tests-sos

dependent_to.description:
TestU01 is a software library, implemented in the ANSI C language, and
offering a collection of utilities for the empirical statistical testing
of uniform random number generators.
dependent_to.name: testu01

dependent_to.description:
TetGen is a program and library that can be used to generate tetrahedral
meshes for given 3D polyhedral domains. TetGen generates exact
constrained Delaunay tetrahedralizations, boundary conforming Delaunay
meshes, and Voronoi paritions.
dependent_to.name: tetgen

dependent_to.description:
Tethex is designed to convert triangular (in 2D) or tetrahedral (in 3D)
Gmsh's mesh to quadrilateral or hexahedral one respectively. These
meshes can be used in software packages working with hexahedrals only -
for example, deal.II.
dependent_to.name: tethex

dependent_to.description: A highly customizable texinfo to HTML and other formats translator.
dependent_to.name: texi2html

dependent_to.description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.
dependent_to.name: texinfo

dependent_to.description:
TeX Live is an easy (we hope) way to get up and running with the TeX
document production system. It provides a comprehensive TeX system with
binaries for most flavors of Unix, including GNU/Linux, macOS, and also
Windows. It includes all the major TeX-related programs, macro packages,
and fonts that are free software, including support for many languages
around the world.
dependent_to.name: texlive

dependent_to.description:
TeXstudio is a fully featured LaTeX editor, whose goal is to make
writing LaTeX documents as easy and comfortable as possible.
dependent_to.name: texstudio

dependent_to.description:
Text Parser library allows us to describe and to parse JSON like simple
parameter structure.
dependent_to.name: textparser

dependent_to.description:
The TFEL project is a collaborative development of CEA (French
Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission) and EDF (Electricite
de France). It mostly contains the MFront code generator which
translates a set of closely related domain specific languages into plain
C++ on top of the TFEL libraries. MFront handles material properties,
mechanical behaviours and simple point-wise models. Interfaces are
provided for several finite element solvers, such as: Abaqus/Standard,
Abaqus/Explicit, Ansys APDL, Cast3M, Europlexus, Code_Aster, CalculiX

dependent_to.description:
Verilator is the fastest free Verilog HDL simulator. It compiles
synthesizable Verilog (not test-bench code!), plus some PSL,
SystemVerilog and Synthesis assertions into C++ or SystemC code. It is
designed for large projects where fast simulation performance is of
primary concern, and is especially well suited to generate executable
models of CPUs for embedded software design teams. Please do not
download this program if you are expecting a full featured replacement
for NC-Verilog, VCS or another commercial Verilog simulator or Verilog
compiler for a little project! (Try Icarus instead.) However, if you are
looking for a path to migrate synthesizable Verilog to C++ or SystemC,
and writing just a touch of C code and Makefiles doesn't scare you off,
this is the free Verilog compiler for you. Verilator supports the
synthesis subset of Verilog, plus initial statements, proper
blocking/non-blocking assignments, functions, tasks, multi-dimensional
arrays, and signed numbers. It also supports very simple forms of
SystemVerilog assertions and coverage analysis. Verilator supports the
more important Verilog 2005 constructs, and some SystemVerilog features,
with additional constructs being added as users request them. Verilator
has been used to simulate many very large multi-million gate designs
with thousands of modules.
dependent_to.name: verilator

dependent_to.description:
A floating-point error checker. Verrou helps you look for floating-point
round-off errors in programs. It implements a stochastic floating-point
arithmetic based on random rounding: all floating-point operations are
perturbed by randomly switching rounding modes. This can be seen as an
asynchronous variant of the CESTAC method, or a subset of Monte Carlo
Arithmetic, performing only output randomization through random
rounding.
dependent_to.name: verrou

dependent_to.description:
Virtual Geometry Model (VGM) is a geometry conversion tool, actually
providing conversion between Geant4 and ROOT TGeo geometry models.
dependent_to.name: vgm

dependent_to.description:
X Video Extension. This extension provides a protocol for a video output
mechanism, mainly to rescale video playback in the video controller
hardware.
dependent_to.name: videoproto

dependent_to.description:
The ViennaRNA Package consists of a C code library and several stand-
alone programs for the prediction and comparison of RNA secondary
structures.
dependent_to.name: viennarna

dependent_to.description:
viewres displays a tree showing the widget class hierarchy of the Athena
Widget Set (libXaw).
dependent_to.name: viewres

dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures
dependent_to.name: vigra

dependent_to.description:
Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to enable efficient text
editing. It is an improved version of the vi editor distributed with
most UNIX systems. Vim is often called a "programmer's editor," and so
useful for programming that many consider it an entire IDE. It's not
just for programmers, though. Vim is perfect for all kinds of text
editing, from composing email to editing configuration files.
dependent_to.name: vim

dependent_to.description:
A fallback std::experimental::simd (Parallelism TS 2) implementation
with additional features.
dependent_to.name: vir-simd

dependent_to.description:
VirtualGL redirects 3D commands from a Unix/Linux OpenGL application
onto a server-side GPU and converts the rendered 3D images into a video
stream with which remote clients can interact to view and control the 3D
application in real time.
dependent_to.name: virtualgl

dependent_to.description:
Virtuoso is a high-performance and scalable Multi-Model RDBMS, Data
Integration Middleware, Linked Data Deployment, and HTTP Application
Server Platform
dependent_to.name: virtuoso

dependent_to.description:
VisIt is an Open Source, interactive, scalable, visualization, animation
and analysis tool.
dependent_to.name: visit

dependent_to.description:
This is the CGNS Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along CGNS library.
dependent_to.name: visit-cgns

dependent_to.description:
This is the FFP Plug-In for VisIt. Can be installed after VisIt is
installed with/without the STRIPACK library.
dependent_to.name: visit-ffp

dependent_to.description:
This is the MFEM Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along MFEM library.
dependent_to.name: visit-mfem

dependent_to.description:
This is the Silo Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along SILO library. It is made as an extension to VisIt that
can be activated or as an environment with a view: ~/.visit Complete
explanation at:
https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/22907#issuecomment-824218296
dependent_to.name: visit-silo

dependent_to.description: This is the UNV Plug-In for VisIt.
dependent_to.name: visit-unv

dependent_to.description:
Viskores is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for
emerging processor architectures. Viskores supports the fine-grained
concurrency for data analysis and visualization algorithms required to
drive extreme scale computing by providing abstract models for data and
execution that can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many
different processor architectures.
dependent_to.name: viskores

dependent_to.description:
ViTE is a trace explorer. It is a tool to visualize execution traces in
Paje or OTF2 format for debugging and profiling parallel or distributed
applications.
dependent_to.name: vite

dependent_to.description: The Virtual Monte Carlo (VMC) library
dependent_to.name: vmc

dependent_to.description:
VMD provides user-editable materials which can be applied to molecular
geometry. These material properties control the details of how VMD
shades the molecular geometry, and how transparent or opaque the
displayed molecular geometry is. With this feature, one can easily
create nice looking transparent surfaces which allow inner structural
details to be seen within a large molecular structure. The material
controls can be particularly helpful when rendering molecular scenes
using external ray tracers, each of which typically differ slightly.
dependent_to.name: vmd

dependent_to.description:
VOLK is the Vector-Optimized Library of Kernels. It is a library that
contains kernels of hand-written SIMD code for different mathematical
operations. Since each SIMD architecture can be very different and no
compiler has yet come along to handle vectorization properly or highly
efficiently, VOLK approaches the problem differently. For each
architecture or platform that a developer wishes to vectorize for, a new
proto-kernel is added to VOLK. At runtime, VOLK will select the correct
proto-kernel. In this way, the users of VOLK call a kernel for
performing the operation that is platform/architecture agnostic. This
allows us to write portable SIMD code.
dependent_to.name: volk

dependent_to.description: The VOMS native service and APIs.
dependent_to.name: voms

dependent_to.description:
Voro++ is a open source software library for the computation of the
Voronoi diagram, a widely-used tessellation that has applications in
many scientific fields.
dependent_to.name: voropp

dependent_to.description:
VOTCA is a software package which focuses on the analysis of molecular
dynamics data, the development of systematic coarse-graining techniques
as well as methods used for simulating microscopic charge (and exciton)
transport in disordered semiconductors.
dependent_to.name: votca

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining engine.
dependent_to.name: votca-csg

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining tutorials.
dependent_to.name: votca-csg-tutorials

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA coarse-graining extra apps.
dependent_to.name: votca-csgapps

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA charge transport engine.
dependent_to.name: votca-ctp

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the basic tools library of VOTCA.
dependent_to.name: votca-tools

dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA exciton transport engine.
dependent_to.name: votca-xtp

dependent_to.description:
Proxy Application. VPFFT is an implementation of a mesoscale
micromechanical materials model. By solving the viscoplasticity model,
VPFFT simulates the evolution of a material under deformation. The
solution time to the viscoplasticity model, described by a set of
partial differential equations, is significantly reduced by the
application of Fast Fourier Transform in the VPFFT algorithm.
dependent_to.name: vpfft

dependent_to.description:
VPIC is a general purpose particle-in-cell simulation code for modeling
kinetic plasmas in one, two, or three spatial dimensions. It employs a
second-order, explicit, leapfrog algorithm to update charged particle
positions and velocities in order to solve the relativistic kinetic
equation for each species in the plasma, along with a full Maxwell
description for the electric and magnetic fields evolved via a second-
order finite-difference-time-domain (FDTD) solve.
dependent_to.name: vpic

dependent_to.description: VSEARCH is a versatile open-source tool for metagenomics.
dependent_to.name: vsearch

dependent_to.description: vsftpd is a GPL licensed FTP server for UNIX systems, including Linux.
dependent_to.name: vsftpd

dependent_to.description: A tool set for short variant discovery in genetic sequence data.
dependent_to.name: vt

dependent_to.description: A tool to list content of virtual tables in a shared library.
dependent_to.name: vtable-dumper

dependent_to.description:
The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available
software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing and
visualization.
dependent_to.name: vtk

dependent_to.description:
VTK-h is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-h brings together several projects like
VTK-m and DIY2 to provide a toolkit with hybrid parallel capabilities.
dependent_to.name: vtk-h

dependent_to.description:
VTK-m is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-m supports the fine-grained concurrency for
data analysis and visualization algorithms required to drive extreme
scale computing by providing abstract models for data and execution that
can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many different
processor architectures.
dependent_to.name: vtk-m

dependent_to.description:
This library contains Fortran 90 decoder/encoder routines for GRIB
edition 1 with EMC changes. This is part of the NCEPLIBS project.
dependent_to.name: w3emc

dependent_to.description:
w3m is a text-based web browser as well as a pager like `more' or
`less'. With w3m you can browse web pages through a terminal emulator
window (xterm, rxvt or something like that). Moreover, w3m can be used
as a text formatting tool which typesets HTML into plain text.
dependent_to.name: w3m

dependent_to.description:
This library contains Fortran 90 decoder/encoder routines for GRIB
edition 1 with NCO changes. This library is deprecated; all
functionality has been moved to the w3emc library. This is part of the
NCEPLIBS project.
dependent_to.name: w3nco

dependent_to.description:
Wannier90 calculates maximally-localised Wannier functions (MLWFs).
Wannier90 is released under the GNU General Public License.
dependent_to.name: wannier90

dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid GPU/OpenMP/MPI parallelization and load
balancing capabilities.
dependent_to.name: warpx

dependent_to.description: Executes a program periodically, showing output fullscreen.
dependent_to.name: watch

dependent_to.description:
Wayland is a project to define a protocol for a compositor to talk to
its clients as well as a library implementation of the protocol. The
compositor can be a standalone display server running on Linux kernel
modesetting and evdev input devices, an X application, or a wayland
client itself. The clients can be traditional applications, X
servers(rootless or fullscreen) or other display servers.
dependent_to.name: wayland

dependent_to.description:
wayland-protocols contains Wayland protocols that add functionality not
available in the Wayland core protocol. Such protocols either add
completely new functionality, or extend the functionality of some other
protocol either in Wayland core, or some other protocol in wayland-
protocols.
dependent_to.name: wayland-protocols

dependent_to.description: Simulates whole cell models using discrete event simulation.
dependent_to.name: wcs

dependent_to.description:
WCSLIB a C implementation of the coordinate transformations defined in
the FITS WCS papers.
dependent_to.name: wcslib

dependent_to.description: Webbench is a simple website pressure test tool used in Linux.
dependent_to.name: webbench

dependent_to.description:
WeeChat is a fast, light and extensible chat client, with a text-based
user interface.
dependent_to.name: weechat

dependent_to.description: A lightweight and simple webserver benchmarking tool
dependent_to.name: weighttp

dependent_to.description:
GNU Wget is a free software package for retrieving files using HTTP,
HTTPS and FTP, the most widely-used Internet protocols. It is a non-
interactive commandline tool, so it may easily be called from scripts,
cron jobs, terminals without X-Windows support, etc.
dependent_to.name: wget

dependent_to.description: Utility for interacting with GRIB2 files
dependent_to.name: wgrib2

dependent_to.description:
GNU which - is a utility that is used to find which executable (or alias
or shell function) is executed when entered on the shell prompt.
dependent_to.name: which

dependent_to.description: whip is a small C++ abstraction layer for CUDA and HIP.
dependent_to.name: whip

dependent_to.description:
WHIZARD is a program system designed for the efficient calculation of
multi-particle scattering cross sections and simulated event samples.
dependent_to.name: whizard

dependent_to.description:
WI4MPI: Wrapper Interface For MPI performing a light translation between
MPI constants and MPI objects from an MPI implementation to another one
dependent_to.name: wi4mpi

dependent_to.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.
dependent_to.name: winbison

dependent_to.description:
This module provides the definition of the WindowsWM extension to the
X11 protocol, used for coordination between an X11 server and the

be used on Cygwin when running a rootless XWin server.
dependent_to.name: windowswmproto

dependent_to.description:
WiredTiger is an high performance, scalable, production quality, NoSQL,
Open Source extensible platform for data management.
dependent_to.name: wiredtiger

dependent_to.description: Graphical network analyzer and capture tool
dependent_to.name: wireshark

dependent_to.description:
The Wise2 package is now a rather stately bioinformatics package that
has be around for a while. Its key programs are genewise, a program for
aligning proteins or protein HMMs to DNA, and dynamite a rather cranky
"macro language" which automates the production of dynamic programming.
dependent_to.name: wise2

dependent_to.description:
Wonton is a support package for the Portage
(https://github.com/laristra/portage) and Tangram
(https://github.com/laristra/tangram) libraries. It contains some
mesh/state classes, wrappers for other mesh/state libraries and some
utilities required by Portage and Tangram.
dependent_to.name: wonton

dependent_to.description:
WordNet is a large lexical database of English. Nouns, verbs, adjectives
and adverbs are grouped into sets of cognitive synonyms (synsets), each
expressing a distinct concept.
dependent_to.name: wordnet

dependent_to.description:
The WRFIO package is a lightweight WRF-IO API library for Unified Post
Processor (UPP). It reads wrf forecasts (WRF state plus diagnostics).
This is part of the NCEPLIBS project.
dependent_to.name: wrf-io

dependent_to.description:
Wrk is a modern HTTP benchmarking tool capable of generating significant
load when run on a single multi-core CPU.
dependent_to.name: wrk

dependent_to.description: Openwsman command line client
dependent_to.name: wsmancli

dependent_to.description:
Wt, C++ Web Toolkit. Wt is a C++ library for developing web
applications.
dependent_to.name: wt

dependent_to.description: A fuzzy Bruijn graph approach to long noisy reads assembly
dependent_to.name: wtdbg2

dependent_to.description:
"A very powerful performance visualization and analysis tool based on
traces that can be used to analyse any information that is expressed on
its input trace format. Traces for parallel MPI, OpenMP and other
programs can be genereated with Extrae.
dependent_to.name: wxparaver

dependent_to.description:
wxPropertyGrid is a property sheet control for wxWidgets. In other
words, it is a specialized two-column grid for editing properties such
as strings, numbers, flagsets, string arrays, and colours.
dependent_to.name: wxpropgrid

dependent_to.description:
wxWidgets is a C++ library that lets developers create applications for
Windows, Mac OS X, Linux and other platforms with a single code base. It
has popular language bindings for Python, Perl, Ruby and many other
languages, and unlike other cross-platform toolkits, wxWidgets gives
applications a truly native look and feel because it uses the platform's
native API rather than emulating the GUI. It's also extensive, free,
open-source and mature.
dependent_to.name: wxwidgets

dependent_to.description: Simple X server performance benchmarker.
dependent_to.name: x11perf

dependent_to.description: Software library and application for encoding video streams
dependent_to.name: x264

dependent_to.description:

dependent_to.name: xabclib

dependent_to.description:
Xalan-C++ version is a robust implementation of the W3C Recommendations
for XSL Transformations (XSLT) and the XML Path Language (XPath). It
works with the Xerces-C++ XML parser.
dependent_to.name: xalan-c

dependent_to.description:
Xapian is a highly adaptable toolkit which allows developers to easily
add advanced indexing and search facilities to their own applications.
It supports the Probabilistic Information Retrieval model and also
supports a rich set of boolean query operators.
dependent_to.name: xapian-core

dependent_to.description:
The xauth program is used to edit and display the authorization
information used in connecting to the X server.
dependent_to.name: xauth

dependent_to.description:
Xbacklight is used to adjust the backlight brightness where supported.
It uses the RandR extension to find all outputs on the X server
supporting backlight brightness control and changes them all in the same

dependent_to.name: xbacklight

dependent_to.description:
The Xbae widget set consists of the well known XbaeMatrix widget, and

dependent_to.name: xbae

xbiff provides graphical notification of new e-mail. It only handles

dependent_to.name: xbiff

dependent_to.description:
The xbitmaps package contains bitmap images used by multiple
applications built in Xorg.
dependent_to.name: xbitmaps

dependent_to.description: XBraid: Parallel time integration with Multigrid
dependent_to.name: xbraid

dependent_to.description:
xcalc is a scientific calculator X11 client that can emulate a TI-30 or
an HP-10C.
dependent_to.name: xcalc

dependent_to.description: xcb-demo: A collection of demo programs that use the XCB library.

xcb-proto provides the XML-XCB protocol descriptions that libxcb uses to
generate the majority of its code and API.
dependent_to.name: xcb-proto

dependent_to.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.
dependent_to.name: xcb-util

The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of

and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of

The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of

Binary data format designed to store data fields with user-specified
accuracy.
dependent_to.name: xcdf

dependent_to.description: Exchange-Correlation functionals with arbitrary order derivatives.
dependent_to.name: xcfun

dependent_to.description:
xclip is a command line utility that is designed to run on any system
with an X11 implementation. It provides an interface to X selections
("the clipboard") from the command line. It can read data from standard
in or a file and place it in an X selection for pasting into other X
applications. xclip can also print an X selection to standard out, which
can then be redirected to a file or another program.
dependent_to.name: xclip

dependent_to.description:
xclipboard is used to collect and display text selections that are sent
to the CLIPBOARD by other clients. It is typically used to save
CLIPBOARD selections for later use. It stores each CLIPBOARD selection
as a separate string, each of which can be selected.
dependent_to.name: xclipboard

dependent_to.description:
xclock is the classic X Window System clock utility. It displays the
time in analog or digital form, continuously updated at a frequency
which may be specified by the user.
dependent_to.name: xclock

dependent_to.description:
XC-MISC Extension. This extension defines a protocol that provides Xlib
two ways to query the server for available resource IDs.
dependent_to.name: xcmiscproto

dependent_to.description:
xcmsdb is used to load, query, or remove Device Color Characterization
data stored in properties on the root window of the screen as specified
in section 7, Device Color Characterization, of the X11 Inter-Client
Communication Conventions Manual (ICCCM).
dependent_to.name: xcmsdb

dependent_to.description:
xcompmgr is a sample compositing manager for X servers supporting the
XFIXES, DAMAGE, RENDER, and COMPOSITE extensions. It enables basic eye-
candy effects.
dependent_to.name: xcompmgr

dependent_to.description:
xconsole displays in a X11 window the messages which are usually sent to
/dev/console.
dependent_to.name: xconsole

dependent_to.description:
This is a default set of cursor themes for use with libXcursor,
originally created for the XFree86 Project, and now shipped as part of
the X.Org software distribution.
dependent_to.name: xcursor-themes

dependent_to.description: xcursorgen prepares X11 cursor sets for use with libXcursor.
dependent_to.name: xcursorgen

dependent_to.description:
xdbedizzy is a demo of the X11 Double Buffer Extension (DBE) creating a
double buffered spinning scene.
dependent_to.name: xdbedizzy

dependent_to.description:

compression using VCDIFF/RFC 3284 streams.
dependent_to.name: xdelta

dependent_to.description: xditview displays ditroff output on an X display.
dependent_to.name: xditview

dependent_to.description: X Display Manager / XDMCP server.
dependent_to.name: xdm

dependent_to.description:
XDMF, or eXtensible Data Model and Format (XDMF), is a common data model
format to exchange scientific data between High Performance Computing
codes and tools.
dependent_to.name: xdmf3

dependent_to.description: fake keyboard/mouse input, window management, and more
dependent_to.name: xdotool

dependent_to.description:
xdpyinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X server. It
is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined values
for various parameters used in communicating between clients and the
server, and the different types of screens, visuals, and X11 protocol
extensions that are available.
dependent_to.name: xdpyinfo

dependent_to.description: xdriinfo - query configuration information of X11 DRI drivers.
dependent_to.name: xdriinfo

dependent_to.description: Xedit is a simple text editor for X.

dependent_to.description:
Xerces-C++ is a validating XML parser written in a portable subset of
C++. Xerces-C++ makes it easy to give your application the ability to
read and write XML data. A shared library is provided for parsing,
generating, manipulating, and validating XML documents using the DOM,
SAX, and SAX2 APIs.
dependent_to.name: xerces-c

dependent_to.description: QuantStack C++ implementation of Jupyter kernel protocol
dependent_to.name: xeus

dependent_to.description:
xev creates a window and then asks the X server to send it X11 events
whenever anything happens to the window (such as it being moved,
resized, typed in, clicked in, etc.). You can also attach it to an
existing window. It is useful for seeing what causes events to occur and
to display the information that they contain; it is essentially a
debugging and development tool, and should not be needed in normal
usage.
dependent_to.name: xev

dependent_to.description: X Protocol Extensions.

dependent_to.description: xeyes - a follow the mouse X demo, using the X SHAPE extension
dependent_to.name: xeyes

defines a protocol to allow user applications to access the video

This package includes the protocol definitions of the "XFree86-Misc"
extension to the X11 protocol. The "XFree86-Misc" extension is supported
by the XFree86 X server and versions of the Xorg X server prior to Xorg
1.6.

dynamically configuring modelines and gamma.
