dependent_to.name: xfce4-appfinder

dependent_to.description: Panel manager for Xfce4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-panel

dependent_to.description: Session manager for Xfce4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-session

dependent_to.description:
Daemon, manager, and editor to centralize the configuration management
for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfce4-settings

dependent_to.description: xfconf - Configuration Storage System for XFCE4
dependent_to.name: xfconf

dependent_to.description:
xfd - display all the characters in a font using either the X11 core
protocol or libXft2.
dependent_to.name: xfd

dependent_to.description: Xfdesktop is a desktop manager for the Xfce Desktop Environment.
dependent_to.name: xfdesktop

dependent_to.description:
xfindproxy is used to locate available X11 proxy services. It utilizes
the Proxy Management Protocol to communicate with a proxy manager. The
proxy manager keeps track of all available proxy services, starts new
proxies when necessary, and makes sure that proxies are shared whenever
possible.
dependent_to.name: xfindproxy

dependent_to.description:
xfontsel application provides a simple way to display the X11 core
protocol fonts known to your X server, examine samples of each, and
retrieve the X Logical Font Description ("XLFD") full name for a font.
dependent_to.name: xfontsel

dependent_to.description:
This is the Free Software distribution of the XForms Library, a
graphical user interface toolkit for X Window Systems.
dependent_to.name: xforms

dependent_to.description: X Font Server.
dependent_to.name: xfs

dependent_to.description: XFS Dump Tools.
dependent_to.name: xfsdump

dependent_to.description:
xfsinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X font server.
It is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined
values for various parameters used in communicating between clients and
the server, and the font catalogues and alternate servers that are
available.
dependent_to.name: xfsinfo

dependent_to.description: XFS User Tools.
dependent_to.name: xfsprogs

dependent_to.description: xfwm4 is the window manager for Xfce
dependent_to.name: xfwm4

dependent_to.description: xfwp proxies X11 protocol connections, such as through a firewall.
dependent_to.name: xfwp

dependent_to.description:
xgamma allows X users to query and alter the gamma correction of a
monitor via the X video mode extension (XFree86-VidModeExtension).
dependent_to.name: xgamma

dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable. It implements machine
learning algorithms under the Gradient Boosting framework. XGBoost
provides a parallel tree boosting (also known as GBDT, GBM) that solve
many data science problems in a fast and accurate way. The same code
runs on major distributed environment (Hadoop, SGE, MPI) and can solve
problems beyond billions of examples.
dependent_to.name: xgboost

dependent_to.description:
xgc is an X11 graphics demo that shows various features of the X11 core
protocol graphics primitives.
dependent_to.name: xgc

dependent_to.description:
The XHMM C++ software suite was written to call copy number variation
(CNV) from next-generation sequencing projects, where exome capture was
used (or targeted sequencing, more generally).
dependent_to.name: xhmm

dependent_to.description:
xhost is used to manage the list of host names or user names allowed to
make connections to the X server.
dependent_to.name: xhost

dependent_to.description:
X Xinerama Extension. This is an X extension that allows multiple
physical screens controlled by a single X server to appear as a single
screen.
dependent_to.name: xineramaproto

dependent_to.description:
The xinit program is used to start the X Window System server and a
first client program on systems that are not using a display manager
such as xdm.
dependent_to.name: xinit

dependent_to.description: xinput is a utility to configure and test XInput devices.
dependent_to.name: xinput

dependent_to.description: XML-IO-SERVER library for IO management of climate models.
dependent_to.name: xios

dependent_to.description:
The X Keyboard (XKB) Extension essentially replaces the core protocol
definition of a keyboard. The extension makes it possible to specify
clearly and explicitly most aspects of keyboard behaviour on a per-key
basis, and to track more closely the logical and physical state of a
keyboard. It also includes a number of keyboard controls designed to
make keyboards more accessible to people with physical impairments.
dependent_to.name: xkbcomp

dependent_to.description:
The XKB data files for the various keyboard models, layouts, and
locales.
dependent_to.name: xkbdata

dependent_to.description: XKB event daemon demo.
dependent_to.name: xkbevd

dependent_to.description:
xkbprint generates a printable or encapsulated PostScript description of
an XKB keyboard description.
dependent_to.name: xkbprint

dependent_to.description:
xkbutils is a collection of small utilities utilizing the XKeyboard
(XKB) extension to the X11 protocol.
dependent_to.name: xkbutils

dependent_to.description:
This project provides a consistent, well-structured, frequently
released, open source database of keyboard configuration data. The
project is targeted to XKB-based systems.
dependent_to.name: xkeyboard-config

dependent_to.description:
xkill is a utility for forcing the X server to close connections to
clients. This program is very dangerous, but is useful for aborting
programs that have displayed undesired windows on a user's screen.
dependent_to.name: xkill

dependent_to.description:
xload displays a periodically updating histogram of the system load
average.
dependent_to.name: xload

dependent_to.description: The xlogo program simply displays the X Window System logo.
dependent_to.name: xlogo

dependent_to.description: xlsatoms lists the interned atoms defined on an X11 server.
dependent_to.name: xlsatoms

dependent_to.description:
xlsclients is a utility for listing information about the client
applications running on a X11 server.
dependent_to.name: xlsclients

dependent_to.description:
xlsfonts lists fonts available from an X server via the X11 core
protocol.
dependent_to.name: xlsfonts

dependent_to.description: xmag displays a magnified snapshot of a portion of an X11 screen.
dependent_to.name: xmag

dependent_to.description:
xman is a graphical manual page browser using the Athena Widgets (Xaw)
toolkit.
dependent_to.name: xman

dependent_to.description:
xmessage displays a message or query in a window. The user can click on
an "okay" button to dismiss it or can select one of several buttons to
answer a question. xmessage can also exit after a specified time.
dependent_to.name: xmessage

dependent_to.description:
The xmh program provides a graphical user interface to the MH Message
Handling System. To actually do things with your mail, it makes calls to
the MH package.
dependent_to.name: xmh

dependent_to.description: xmlf90 is a suite of libraries to handle XML in Fortran.
dependent_to.name: xmlf90

dependent_to.description: Programming library for writing an XML-RPC server or client in C or C++.
dependent_to.name: xmlrpc-c

dependent_to.description:
Utility xmlto is a simple shell script for converting XML files to
various formats. It serves as easy to use command line frontend to make
fine output without remembering many long options and searching for the
syntax of the backends.
dependent_to.name: xmlto

dependent_to.description:
The xmodmap program is used to edit and display the keyboard modifier
map and keymap table that are used by client applications to convert
event keycodes into keysyms. It is usually run from the user's session
startup script to configure the keyboard according to personal tastes.
dependent_to.name: xmodmap

dependent_to.description: xmore - plain text display program for the X Window System.
dependent_to.name: xmore

dependent_to.description:
XNEdit is a multi-purpose text editor for the X Window System, which
combines a standard, easy to use, graphical user interface with the
thorough functionality and stability.
dependent_to.name: xnedit

dependent_to.description:
High-efficiency floating-point neural network inference operators for
mobile, server, and Web
dependent_to.name: xnnpack

dependent_to.description:
Xolotl is a high-performance computing code using advection-reaction-
diffusion (ADR) kinetic rate theory to model the time evolution of the
divertor material in next generation tokamaks, like ITER, as well as
nuclear fuel in fission reactors.
dependent_to.name: xolotl

dependent_to.description:
The xorg-cf-files package contains the data files for the imake utility,
defining the known settings for a wide variety of platforms (many of
which have not been verified or tested in over a decade), and for many
of the libraries formerly delivered in the X.Org monolithic releases.
dependent_to.name: xorg-cf-files

dependent_to.description:
This package provides miscellaneous documentation for the X Window
System that doesn't better fit into other packages. The preferred
documentation format for these documents is DocBook XML.
dependent_to.name: xorg-docs

dependent_to.description:
Provides a Google Test environment for starting and stopping a X server
for testing purposes.
dependent_to.name: xorg-gtest

dependent_to.description:
X.Org Server is the free and open source implementation of the display
server for the X Window System stewarded by the X.Org Foundation.
dependent_to.name: xorg-server

dependent_to.description:
This package provides a common set of SGML entities and XML/CSS style
sheets used in building/formatting the documentation provided in other
X.Org packages.
dependent_to.name: xorg-sgml-doctools

dependent_to.description: Xprint sample applications.
dependent_to.name: xphelloworld

dependent_to.description: List Xprint printers.
dependent_to.name: xplsprinters

dependent_to.description:
XPMEM is a Linux kernel module that enables a process to map the memory
of another process into its virtual address space.
dependent_to.name: xpmem

dependent_to.description:
xpr takes as input a window dump file produced by xwd and formats it for
output on various types of printers.
dependent_to.name: xpr

dependent_to.description: Rehash list of Xprint printers.
dependent_to.name: xprehashprinterlist

dependent_to.description:
xprop is a command line tool to display and/or set window and font
properties of an X server.
dependent_to.name: xprop

dependent_to.description: C++ library providing traitlets-style properties
dependent_to.name: xproperty

dependent_to.description:
X Window System Core Protocol. This package provides the headers and
specification documents defining the X Window System Core Protocol,
Version 11. It also includes a number of headers that aren't purely
protocol related, but are depended upon by many other X Window System
packages to provide common definitions and porting layer.
dependent_to.name: xproto

dependent_to.description:
The Proxy Management Protocol is an ICE based protocol that provides a
way for application servers to easily locate proxy services available to
them.
dependent_to.name: xproxymanagementprotocol

dependent_to.description:
XQilla is an XQuery and XPath 2 library and command line utility written
in C++, implemented on top of the Xerces-C library.
dependent_to.name: xqilla

dependent_to.description:
xrandr - primitive command line interface to X11 Resize, Rotate, and
Reflect (RandR) extension.
dependent_to.name: xrandr

dependent_to.description: xrdb - X server resource database utility.
dependent_to.name: xrdb

dependent_to.description:
XrdClRecorder Plugin. This XRootD Client Plugin can be used to record
all user's actions on XrdCl::File object and store them into a csv file.
dependent_to.name: xrdcl-record

dependent_to.description: xrefresh - refresh all or part of an X screen.
dependent_to.name: xrefresh

dependent_to.description:
The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault
tolerant access to data repositories of many kinds.
dependent_to.name: xrootd

dependent_to.description:
The remote execution (RX) service specifies a MIME format for invoking
applications remotely, for example via a World Wide Web browser. This RX
format specifies a syntax for listing network services required by the
application, for example an X display server. The requesting Web browser
must identify specific instances of the services in the request to
invoke the application.
dependent_to.name: xrx

dependent_to.description:
XSBench is a mini-app representing a key computational kernel of the
Monte Carlo neutronics application OpenMC. A full explanation of the
theory and purpose of XSBench is provided in docs/XSBench_Theory.pdf.
dependent_to.name: xsbench

dependent_to.description: XSCOPE -- a program to monitor X11/Client conversations.
dependent_to.name: xscope

dependent_to.description:
CodeSynthesis XSD is an open-source, cross-platform W3C XML Schema to
C++ data binding compiler. It support in-memory and event-driven XML
processing models and is available for a wide range of C++ compilers and
platforms.
dependent_to.name: xsd

dependent_to.description: xSDK Examples show usage of libraries in the xSDK package.
dependent_to.name: xsdk-examples

dependent_to.description: User preference utility for X.
dependent_to.name: xset

dependent_to.description: Set the mode for an X Input device.
dependent_to.name: xsetmode

dependent_to.description: Set an X Input device as the main pointer.
dependent_to.name: xsetpointer

dependent_to.description: xsetroot - root window parameter setting utility for X.
dependent_to.name: xsetroot

dependent_to.description: C++ wrappers for SIMD intrinsics
dependent_to.name: xsimd

dependent_to.description: X Session Manager.
dependent_to.name: xsm

dependent_to.description:
The xstdcmap utility can be used to selectively define standard colormap
properties. It is intended to be run from a user's X startup script to
create standard colormap definitions in order to facilitate sharing of
scarce colormap resources among clients using PseudoColor visuals.
dependent_to.name: xstdcmap

dependent_to.description: LCLS II Developement: XTCData.
dependent_to.name: xtcdata

dependent_to.description: Multi-dimensional arrays with broadcasting and lazy computing
dependent_to.name: xtensor

dependent_to.description: BLAS extension to xtensor
dependent_to.name: xtensor-blas

dependent_to.description: Python bindings for the xtensor C++ multi-dimensional array library
dependent_to.name: xtensor-python

dependent_to.description:
The xterm program is a terminal emulator for the X Window System. It
provides DEC VT102 and Tektronix 4014 compatible terminals for programs
that can't use the window system directly.
dependent_to.name: xterm

dependent_to.description: QuantStack tools library
dependent_to.name: xtl

dependent_to.description:
xtrans is a library of code that is shared among various X packages to
handle network protocol transport in a modular fashion, allowing a
single place to add new transport types. It is used by the X server,
libX11, libICE, the X font server, and related components.
dependent_to.name: xtrans

dependent_to.description: XTrap sample clients.
dependent_to.name: xtrap

dependent_to.description:
This is a revamped version of X Test Suite (XTS) which removes some of
the ugliness of building and running the tests.
dependent_to.name: xts

dependent_to.description:
XV image viewer. The XV software was originally written by John
Bradley. John Bradley's web site for the XV software can be found at:
http://www.trilon.com/xv
dependent_to.name: xv

dependent_to.description:
xvidtune is a client interface to the X server video mode extension
(XFree86-VidModeExtension).
dependent_to.name: xvidtune

dependent_to.description:
xvinfo prints out the capabilities of any video adaptors associated with
the display that are accessible through the X-Video extension.
dependent_to.name: xvinfo

dependent_to.description: xwd - dump an image of an X window.
dependent_to.name: xwd

dependent_to.description: A C++ backend for Jupyter interactive widgets
dependent_to.name: xwidgets

dependent_to.description:
xwininfo prints information about windows on an X server. Various
information is displayed depending on which options are selected.
dependent_to.name: xwininfo

dependent_to.description:
xwud allows X users to display in a window an image saved in a specially
formatted dump file, such as produced by xwd.
dependent_to.name: xwud

dependent_to.description:
xxd creates a hex dump of a given file or standard input. It is bundled
with vim, but as xxd is used in build scripts, it makes sense to have it
available as a standalone package.
dependent_to.name: xxd-standalone

dependent_to.description: Graphical File And Directories Comparator And Merge Tool.
dependent_to.name: xxdiff

dependent_to.description:
xxHash is an Extremely fast Hash algorithm, running at RAM speed limits.
It successfully completes the SMHasher test suite which evaluates
collision, dispersion and randomness qualities of hash functions. Code
is highly portable, and hashes are identical on all platforms (little /
big endian).
dependent_to.name: xxhash

dependent_to.description:
Xyce (rhymes with 'spice') is an open source, SPICE-compatible, high-
performance analog circuit simulator, Xyce supports the standard
analysis capabilities found in other SPICE-like codes, such as DC,
transient, AC, and small-signal noise analyses; it also has less common
capabilities, such as harmonic balance, sensitivity analysis, and
uncertainty propagation techniques. Xyce supplies industry-standard
compact models and can support custom models via its Verilog-A model
compiler. Foundry process-development kits (PDKs) in other SPICE syntax
can be used via the XDM netlist translator, which is included as part of
the Xyce package. In addition to supporting use on all common desktop
platforms (Mac, Windows, Linux), Xyce can also be compiled to run in a
large-scale parallel mode to provide scalable, numerically accurate
analog simulation of circuits containing millions of devices, or more.
dependent_to.name: xyce

dependent_to.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.
dependent_to.name: xz

dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.
dependent_to.name: yade

dependent_to.description:
yet another Fortran (implementation of) YAML There is at least one
other open source Fortran-based YAML parser. The rationale for this one
is simply to be compatible with the containers in gFTL. It is not
intended to be a complete YAML parser, just the subset needed by my own
projects.
dependent_to.name: yafyaml

dependent_to.description: Yet Another JSON Library (YAJL)
dependent_to.name: yajl

dependent_to.description:
Yaksa is a high-performance datatype engine for expressing, managing and
manipulating data present in noncontiguous memory regions. It provides
portable abstractions for structured noncontiguous data layouts that are
much more comprehensive compared with traditional I/O vectors. Yaksa
imitates parts of the MPI Datatype system, but adds additional
functionality that would allow it to be used independent of MPI. It
provides routines for packing/unpacking, creating I/O vectors (array of
contiguous segments) and flattening/unflattening datatypes into process-
portable formats. Yaksa's backend includes support for CPUs as well as
different GPUs.
dependent_to.name: yaksa

dependent_to.description:
Yambo is a FORTRAN/C code for Many-Body calculations in solid state and
molecular physics. Yambo relies on the Kohn-Sham wavefunctions generated
by two DFT public codes: abinit, and PWscf. The code was originally
developed in the Condensed Matter Theoretical Group of the Physics
Department at the University of Rome "Tor Vergata" by Andrea Marini.
Previous to its release under the GPL license, yambo was known as SELF.
dependent_to.name: yambo

dependent_to.description: A YAML parser and emitter in C++
dependent_to.name: yaml-cpp

dependent_to.description:
YARA is a tool aimed at (but not limited to) helping malware researchers
to identify and classify malware samples
dependent_to.name: yara

dependent_to.description:
Yasm is a complete rewrite of the NASM-2.11.06 assembler. It supports
the x86 and AMD64 instruction sets, accepts NASM and GAS assembler
syntaxes and outputs binary, ELF32 and ELF64 object formats.
dependent_to.name: yasm

dependent_to.description: YODA - Yet more Objects for Data Analysis
dependent_to.name: yoda

dependent_to.description:
Yorick is an interpreted programming language for scientific simulations
or calculations, postprocessing or steering large simulation codes,
interactive scientific graphics, and reading, writing, or translating
files of numbers. Yorick includes an interactive graphics package, and a
binary file package capable of translating to and from the raw numeric
formats of all modern computers. Yorick is written in ANSI C and runs on
most operating systems (*nix systems, MacOS X, Windows).
dependent_to.name: yorick

dependent_to.description:
Yosys is a framework for RTL synthesis tools. It currently has extensive
Verilog-2005 support and provides a basic set of synthesis algorithms
for various application domains. Yosys can be adapted to perform any
synthesis job by combining the existing passes (algorithms) using
synthesis scripts and adding additional passes as needed by extending
the yosys C++ code base. Yosys is free software licensed under the ISC
license (a GPL compatible license that is similar in terms to the MIT
license or the 2-clause BSD license).
dependent_to.name: yosys

dependent_to.description: The fastest JSON library in C
dependent_to.name: yyjson

dependent_to.description: a library to perform the compression assessment for lossy compressors
dependent_to.name: z-checker

dependent_to.description:
Z3 is a theorem prover from Microsoft Research. It is licensed under the
MIT license.
dependent_to.name: z3

dependent_to.description:
Real-time monitoring of IT components and services, such as networks,
servers, VMs, applications and the cloud.
dependent_to.name: zabbix

dependent_to.description:
Utility for monitoring process, thread, OS and HW resources, including
GPU utilization.
dependent_to.name: zerosum

dependent_to.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.
dependent_to.name: zfp

dependent_to.description:
OpenZFS is an advanced file system and volume manager which was
originally developed for Solaris and is now maintained by the OpenZFS
community. This repository contains the code for running OpenZFS on
Linux and FreeBSD.
dependent_to.name: zfs

dependent_to.description:
Realistic assessment of both launch and wireup requirements of MPI
applications
dependent_to.name: ziatest

dependent_to.description:
A general-purpose programming language and toolchain for maintaining
robust, optimal, and reusable software.
dependent_to.name: zig

dependent_to.description: Zip is a compression and file packaging/archive utility.
dependent_to.name: zip

dependent_to.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.
dependent_to.name: zlib

dependent_to.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
dependent_to.name: zlib-ng

dependent_to.description:
The Zoltan library is a toolkit of parallel combinatorial algorithms for
parallel, unstructured, and/or adaptive scientific applications.
Zoltan's largest component is a suite of dynamic load-balancing and
partitioning algorithms that increase applications' parallel performance
by reducing idle time. Zoltan also has graph coloring and graph ordering
algorithms, which are useful in task schedulers and parallel
preconditioners.
dependent_to.name: zoltan

dependent_to.description:
Zopfli Compression Algorithm is a compression library programmed in C to
perform very good, but slow, deflate or zlib compression.
dependent_to.name: zopfli

dependent_to.description:
z-Pares is designed to compute a few eigenvalues and eigenvectors of
sparse matrices.
dependent_to.name: zpares

dependent_to.description:
Zsh is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a
powerful scripting language. Many of the useful features of bash, ksh,
and tcsh were incorporated into zsh; many original features were added.
dependent_to.name: zsh

dependent_to.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.
dependent_to.name: zstd

dependent_to.description: A tiny Racket for scripting.
dependent_to.name: zuo

dependent_to.description:
Platform independent types, macros and a fallback for environments
without LibC
dependent_to.name: zycore-c

dependent_to.description: The ultimate, open-source x86 and x86-64 decoder/disassembler library.
dependent_to.name: zydis

dependent_to.description:
The zziplib provides read access to zipped files in a zip-archive, using
compression based solely on free algorithms provided by zlib. It also
provides a functionality to overlay the archive filesystem with the
filesystem of the operating system environment.
dependent_to.name: zziplib

description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
name: gmake

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Support GNU Guile for embedded scripting
variants.name: guile
